composer.rawText:
[Title: Salt on the Northern Wind]
[Style: Scottish folk orchestral, clean studio recording, instruments: Great Highland bagpipes, fiddle, acoustic guitar, bodhrán, frame drum, cello, upright bass, male emotive tenor vocalist]
[Refresh Title: Sailing the Seas]
[Theme: Colors]
[Gradients: 3]
[Seed: 62]
[Image: Grey-green waves beneath a heather sky, a lone sail edged with tartan red]
[Caption: Old routes sung anew by wind and tide]
[Created: January 25, 2026 at 11:03 PM]
[Composer Version: v1.2]

[Intro]
The wind comes down from broken hills
It names the lochs, it bends our wills

[Verse]
We loose the lines at first light’s call
While echoes ring from stone to wall
The pipes awake the waiting bay
And chase the sleep from brine and spray

[Verse]
These boards have known both storm and song
They’ve borne us short, they’ve borne us long
Each scar recalls a ચૂક course tried
And lessons learned from turning tide

[Chorus]
Oh heave away, my roving kin
Let northern stars our path begin
Through iron swell and silver sea
We sail where we are meant to be

[Verse]
The gulls cry out in broken time
Like half-remembered ancient rhyme
The compass spins, then settles true
As hearts do when they choose the blue

[Bridge]
If mist should fall and hide the shore
We’ll trust the songs we sang before
For every loss the waters give
Returns as will, returns as live

[Chorus]
Oh heave away, my roving kin
Let northern stars our path begin
Through iron swell and silver sea
We sail where we are meant to be

[Ending]
The tide goes quiet, oars at rest
The sea keeps warm what we confessed

headerMap.Title: Salt on the Northern Wind
headerMap.Style: Scottish folk orchestral, clean studio recording, instruments: Great Highland bagpipes, fiddle, acoustic guitar, bodhrán, frame drum, cello, upright bass, male emotive tenor vocalist
headerMap.Image: Grey-green waves beneath a heather sky, a lone sail edged with tartan red
headerMap.Caption: Old routes sung anew by wind and tide

lyrics.rawText:
The wind comes down from broken hills
It names the lochs, it bends our wills

We loose the lines at first light’s call
While echoes ring from stone to wall
The pipes awake the waiting bay
And chase the sleep from brine and spray

These boards have known both storm and song
They’ve borne us short, they’ve borne us long
Each scar recalls a ચૂક course tried
And lessons learned from turning tide

Oh heave away, my roving kin
Let northern stars our path begin
Through iron swell and silver sea
We sail where we are meant to be

The gulls cry out in broken time
Like half-remembered ancient rhyme
The compass spins, then settles true
As hearts do when they choose the blue

If mist should fall and hide the shore
We’ll trust the songs we sang before
For every loss the waters give
Returns as will, returns as live

Oh heave away, my roving kin
Let northern stars our path begin
Through iron swell and silver sea
We sail where we are meant to be

The tide goes quiet, oars at rest
The sea keeps warm what we confessed
